reviews.review_msg: Worst professor ever, makes easy concepts extremely hard. Wouldn't recommend him at all

The lecture is long and sometimes  it gets boring,  the test are the simplify version of the textbook practices he assigned for tutorial. He is really patient and helpful, the only one  has office hour from Mon to Fri.
Come to class frequently. If you work hard, you'll do well in this class. Average percentage usually is about 51%.

Took ECON201  with Andrew , his lecture notes are clear , very helpful and knowledgeable, I never missed a lecture and did my homeworks and got A- don't know why everyone say he is tough .  Final and Midterm were much easier than the homework questions
go to tutorial
Very helpful prof, nice guy. Very clear lecture notes.????

This is a difficult course but if you study, you will do fine.  Do all the problem sets!  The hw answers are on canvas and you can get the sample exam solutions from the prof.  Prof is a good lecturer with clear slides.  Poor guy always looks so sad, though.
Very clear explanation in materials. Knowledgeable professor, but some times do not really care about students.

To be honest, this course is hard and somehow torturing. You will pass this course if you have interests in the study of economics. Prof is nice, helpful and pretty clear in explaining the materials. There is no reason to blame the prof due to failing, etc.
I like this professor, and I got a good mark in this course. His exam is fair. If you have a good understanding of his lecture slides, you will be fine. It is not the hard course.

I can't believe these comments - at all. This class isn't mean to be easy and if you looked at the midterms, the get progressively easier and easier. Why blame the professor for doing his job? I had a great time, guy is kind of looks sad all the time but he knows what hes talking about. Friendly during office hours as well.
Run while you still can..oh ya and dont pay 200$ for a textbook you never open because all the questions he asks are completely different

Non-organize, Powerpoint slide not help. He doesnt know how to teach, even he doesnt remember what should he teach in lecture. He always said that "talk it in next lecuture", then that all. If u reli want to fail this course, take this class then.

201 is Killer Course with Hard Econ concept and moderate math skills are highly recommended. McGee is heavy theory-based teacher with hard Exam questions which requires well-understanding of the lecture material. However, he did love to throw textbook question into his quiz.Textbook is like his notes,hard to understand.
201 is difficult but he made it easy. Genuinely, just do the practice problems he gave and you will succeed.
Good prof, easy to understand and tests were easy. All I studied was the practice problems and past tests he posted and got an A+.
One of the best professors in the econ department, his tests were definitely one of the easiest among all the other econ courses I took.
Best prof.
One of the worst handwriting I've ever seen and there's no slides provided

Super clear lecture. He actually tells you how to solve the problems during lectures, and if you go to his office hours, he will take his time to teach you how to solve them. Make sure you read over the lectures and all his exams are based on the lecture notes. 2 midterms and 1final, tough, but dw, everyone else are "indifferent" (wink wink)

This is the professor that made me decide not to do an Economic Minor and turned me off the area of study. He was incredibly boring, would write illegible mess  on an overhead all class, and brought lots of math into the class which was unnecessary. I do not recommend at all.

His assignments seem easy, the examples in class seem easy, but wait until you get to the midterm and the exams. Hard AF. Go to  your tutorials, do the practice problems, and ask your TA for help. I've never taken such a hard class.  The exams have 5 true or false questions, and 3-4 multi-part long problems.  Good luck.
His tests are really hard, good luck guys.
ECON 201 is a nightmare for me. Hard exams and time consuming assignments.

less math based than other profs but still hard, practice exams are easier than actual exams with curveball questions. He is a good explainer but you don't hear anything he says because you're trying to decode what he's writing . He's friendly enough but doesn't reply to emails and doesn't help out beyond class time and 1 office hour after class

His tests are really hard. Terrible handwriting. He gave you 2 practice finals from 2014 and 2015. And the 2016 final is completely different. Avoid it at all cost. He only have one office hour (1hr) per week.

Great prof.  Perfectly paced lecturesnotes that really help you understand the material-I was rarely bored.  Karaivanov seems like a helpful prof.  As ECON's gatekeeper, I found this course too easy though.  The exam material is very straightforward IMO, finished with an A+.  If you think you're good at BASIC derivative calculus, you'll ace it.

Great Prof. He is very knowledgeable and super nice. Very handsome as well. Easy to understand and you will never fall as sleep in his class. Exams and assignments are fair but not easy (especially the true false section).  However, his handwriting is terrible and he has only one day (1 hour) office hour per week.

Took ECON 201, 260 with him. He's one of those profs who just goes there to get things done, probably not passionate about teaching. He doesn't have slides so he writes down his notes, which could look a bit unorganized (poor handwriting). He gives problem sets which are quite similar to the exams. If you want to do the bare minimum, he's the guy
Made a pretty boring class quite interesting with great lectures

He doesn't use slides for his lecture and only writes with poor handwriting. also, he change his midterm exam coverage three times!!! Never reply to emails in a reasonable time and exams do not have enough time to finish. He teaches his own way and solution rather than the textbook.

The professor does not use PPT in class. He just writes by hand. His handwriting is terrible. The quiz question is tricky but important, make sure you understand all the theories. Be sure to study in advance, otherwise you won't understand anything in class. Homework and exams are extremely difficult!

One of the best professors i have ever had since last year. Very caring, funny and his final was super duper easy (Thats a different story that I did not study at all and still got a B). He held extra officer hours before the exams, was always encouraging questions after lectures outside the lecture room and even made the course easy.

This prof is my favourite econ prof honestly. He gives a lot of good real-world examples and makes it way easier to understand compared to the textbook. He is funny and very helpful. If you dont like him, either you didnt listen the class or econ is not for you. The class is hard, that s not the prof s fault. He explained everything clearly.

You will be just fine don't panic. He doesn't test on mathematical part mostly. His practice MCQs would get you full on MCQs. Don't use the book, use his class notes and notes on his website. Homework is a lot if you want to understand it.

Econ 201 is a hard class. Shora really tried to explain things in the easiest way possible, however you have to work a lot. This course needs a lot of work. Shora was always ready to help, after class or in office hours.

This is a hard class which requires to put effort on but overall she is a nice prof. She tries to explain everything clearly and if you have questions she is always available for help. Tutorial and assignments are easy. But u really need to study and understand course materials rather than memorizing things to do good.

He is setting you up to do poorly. Lectures are extremely boring and he seems like he has little experience. Entire grade based mainly on midterm and final which had failing averages after he gave everyone 5 extra points. There are 3 essays and I don't know anyone who even received a passing grade on them. Not sure how were going to pass.
Erik makes tough exams. lectures and ppt aren't really helpful. Gotta study all by yourself.
test very long can't even finish class average is not even 50%
very smart guy, 5 random quiz per semester but it isn't that hard. Exam and Mid term are base on the lecture note.
Avoid him. random pop quiz + hard exam

He gives simple analogies about concepts, and solves the math problems step by step without skipping anything. If you're bad at calculus, it doesn't matter who the professor is, you'll find 201 hard, but Erik teaches it really well. His quizzes are an easy 20% of the grade and his tests are really fair.
Read the textbook beforehand, then you will understand whats going on in class. Go to the tutorials, then you will know whats going on during your mid-term & finals.

His lectures help if you read the textbook beforehand; regardless, the material is pretty challenging for a 200-level course. The math knowledge required transcends Calc I - if you study hard, know at least Calc II math, and go to ProfTA's office hours, you might have a chance at an A. Don't slack, pop quizzes  20%; hard MT (40%) - need intuition

He is very nice but not really clear with explaining the materials. He made pretty hard mt and final. Since his lecture notes is not very clear and he has no sample tests, it became really hard to prepare for exams. I barely studied the whole course by reading the textbook myself.
All the material he goes though he doesn't explain well at all! Most of the students have no idea whats going on and he doesn't care. I would avoid him if possible

he is pretty good, the lectures are easy, and midterm with final mostly from them. the book you can read for additional information, and the workbook for practice which is not that hard. the books are expensive, but you can find both of the books online and for free. the random quizzes i thought would be bad, but they are pretty easy and worth 5%.

She is definitely one of the best economics instructors at SFU. I'm so glad I took 201 with her. She conveyed the material perfectly clear and made the otherwise difficult course much simpler. You will be glad you took 201 with her. btw over a quarter of the class received an A in this course.

Honestly if you're a business student I would not recommend you take this class. As someone who did really well in Econ 105 and 103, this class was very difficult. The TA that I had did not know how to teach so tutorials felt like a waste of time but the only way you get participation marks is if you talk not just show up. Definitely take BUS 207.

Honestly one of the best professors I had the honour of studying with. Made the notoriously difficult course quite interesting and relatively easy to learn. Does not bore you with ALL the material, rather, clearly and concisely explains the material, then clarifies on specifics and various shortcuts. Very helpful with office hours and assignments.

The class is really hard in nature, but Josh helped make it easier to understand. The lectures are a bit confusing at first but going to his office hours really helps. The assignments are really hard but he basically will tell you what to do if you ask. Test averages were really low and pretty difficult.

Probably one of the best teachers I've had in University. If you love Economics, he will definitely help you deepen that. He made a class with a low pass rate very enjoyable, just overall a great teacher and great person. If you are able to take a class with him, count yourself lucky
Good guy but good luck with the exams !

I found Josh's assignments struck a great balance of challenge and concept testing, and tutorials were engaging, but exams felt comparatively much more difficult. Josh is super accessible outside of class time and is always willing to assist students who are engaging with the material. I would gladly take another course in economics with him.

Josh is alright, relatively nice guy who was open to questions. however the structure of ECON 201 was ridiculous. His lecture examples, tutorial questions and quizzes could not even come close to prepare you for his exams even though they are open book the averages are 15/50 because he underprepared you by sharing easy examples and then rails you

Where do I even begin. He's teaching style isn't the best. He'll go over the general concepts in class then he'll give you 'tutorial questions' which weren't explained on his lecture slides. The class average for the final was 15/50! DON"T TAKE HIS CLASS!

Really nice and understanding prof; no question is stupid to him. His exams are open book and not the easiest, but as long as you go to all of the tutorials you should be able to recognize the questions and what he is looking for.
The most caring professor I've ever had. Material for this class is challenging, but Josh is very approachable and answers questions clearly. 100% recommend Josh

Josh was very knowledgeable and passionate about the content. His lectures were a bit all over the place but the professor was good at explaining during office hours. The problem with the class was the unavailable TA's (all) that didn't show up to office hours and/or didn't have answers or had wrong answers. A lot of content, don't fall behind!

A new professor who has just taken office. He is very kind, and all the exams are open. The exam is very difficult and time is tight. You need to understand and master all the small knowledge points and spend at least ten hours of study a week to finish his exam. I heard recommending his econ201, because although it is difficult to score, you can't

Josh really cares about how effective his teaching is and always seeks feedback from his students. Many extra credit opportunities in terms of his feedback surveys; this is unheard of coming from a STEM student. He is very patient, no question is stupid to him. Tests are fair and mostly similar to practice material.

Josh is a really good professor. He is able to make Econ 201 less scary despite the difficulty and amount of math in the course. He had us do weekly quizzes and homework for participation to boost our averages. His assignments were very similar to his exams, and he provided a lot of material to work with.

Avoid 201 with him like the plague. Get ready to be slammed with theories and concepts- you wont pass if you don't study. Focus on key concepts and build theory around those. PRACTICE. He is really helpful- but only if you put in effort yourself.
Awesome
G.O.A.T

Fernando's exams are difficult, but you will be fine if you do all the practices he post on canvas and do problem sets he assigns for each week. And remember that this is a curve course, as long as you pay more effort than others I believe you will be fine. Good luck :)
If you can take lecture from another professor, do so. Aragon is too hard a market and his lecture and exams have no coherence. How people pass is this course is mostly luck. NOT RECOMMENDED!

His exam is hard. But as long as you solve tutorial questions, you will do well on his exams. Since the textbook does not have answers for these questions, it will be worth for you to attend tutorials.
I will never take any ECON class with this professor. Useless lectures and it is not quite relevant to the mid-term. If you want to graduate, don't risk your grade with him.

Fernando was a good professor for what is a very hard course! I found him to be fair, but he went very in depth with some very difficult material. He is a good person and a funny professor though, and always engaged the class well.

You will have to work very hard to get a good grade in Fernando's class, but he tries his hardest to explain everything clearly. Show up to every lecture, read ahead to familiarize yourself, and participate in tutorial and success will be easy to find!
final exam average was 19% and final grade average was 38%.. only reason i passed was because of the curve

He is good at explaining the core concepts. But his exams are incredibly tough. If you're taking ECON 201, practising questions in tutorial is actually more important than attending lectures (although you shouldn't skip lectures). Anybody who practices questions AND past exams should do well in his class because most people don't practice.

One of the best teachers I've ever had, would like to take more classes with him. Explains everything really good and clear, but you should be ready to practice by yourself. Exams are not difficult but tricky sometimes.

It's important to realize that the content of this class is very tough no matter who you take it with. He explains the type of questions to focus on for exams in lectures so attend all lectures to keep up with the class. I recommend working on past exams so you get used to the format of the Midterm and Final. All the best!

Lecture contents are easy to follow and understand. However exams are incredibly hard. For the final he mentioned that he would use problems from previous exams however it was all a lie, I couldn't finish any of the questions. There's no point in trying hard in his class because the only way to pass is because of the curve.

what he taught in lecture is easy, but the exam is hard, also you don't have enough time to finish it.You cannot use calculate during the exams however,the numbers he gave in the exams are always non-integer. His handwriting is barely readable. He doesn't like reply emails. ave 38.25 in the mid-term and 27.4 in the final

Useless Prof, made students more confused after lectures, simply cannot teach. Even the TAs were more helpful; I owe my grades to the tutorials but not the lectures! Very bad prof, just avoid him at all cost.
Smart and knowledgable prof. If you fully understand the lecture notes you will do fine. Helpful and patient when you ask him questions during the office hour. Very strict on the exams though.
prof was a nice guy. exams are fair and the class is graded on a curve so it wasn't so bad.
Probably the worst EOCN prof you can get. Poor notes and hard exams. Expects you to know everything and do hard calculations by hand. Avoid at all costs.

This guy is probably the worst professor I have ever had. He is disorganized, his writing is barely readable, he uses poor examples to explain the material, and he is not helpful at all. I would not recommend this guy to my worst enemy!!!

Fernando seems like he has better things to do than teach.  He lectures RIGHT out of the textbook - moreover, his handwriting is barely legible.  Gives (relatively) easy midterms, then expects the world for the final.  Overall, a horrible experience

He has a lot of passion for the subject, but he has problems articulating and teaching it to the class. There is at least 1 mistake (likely multiple) every lecture, very long tests within short time frames, and a math-heavy approach that he doesn't explain well. Avoid if you can, but if not, prepare to teach yourself w/ textbook and videos.
Brutal exams. Curve and homework saved me in the end.

He seems to not prepare enough for the lecture because he needs to correct his powerpoint mistakes every class! It's waste of time for us to wait for him to correct his mistakes and explain his not so clear concepts once again. The essay question is also ridiculous and hard in tests.

Worst teacher ever ... slides are often wrong. Tests are extraordinary hard and he cannot teach the material. He is tough marker too. For his first midterm the highest mark in class for the only short answer question was 4/10. Avoid taking course with him

Extremely long exam with only one hour to finish. That is not possible!!!!! Guys, just prevent taking course with this prof. You just learn nothing from his lectures. AND exams are unreasonably long and tough. Worst prof Ive ever had.

Very disorganized, powerpoint slides are all over the place, not clear at all. Does not do a good job teaching and relaying knowledge clearly. Gives exams that are impossibly long to complete. Makes the material harder than it has to be for a 2nd year course. Highly do not recommend to take this teacher.

I'm sure he is smart and he is caring about students but unfortunately I found him not a good teacher. I'm sorry if you are reading this David but the points that you teach in your lecture may seem easy to you but for students it is not as straightforward and you don't give them time to understand them.

The lectures are boring, and he has many random tests without notice to grade participation. I learned a lot from his lectures and tutorials, but in the tests, the questions are very complicated, not only for me but also for most of the students. He is a strict grader.

I WENT TO ALL THE LECTURES DID MY QUIZZES AND EVERYTHING BUT TELL ME WHY THE EXAM WAS NOTHING LIKE WHAT WE PRACTICED??? LIKE HE SAYS U ONLY NEED TUTORIAL BUT LIKE ITS NOT EVEN THE SAME AND THE GRADING IS BAD TOO AFTER ALL THAT STUDYING I SOMEHOW BARELY PASSES??? WHAT IS THIS PROF DONT TAKE PLS SAVE UR GPA- SO HARD EXAMS!!!!

The class was quite difficult but he is a very generous marker and you will get a lot of half points for just showing an attempt at the question. My only real gripe is that at times it was unclear what exactly would be tested on the midterm and the final. Overall, I don't think Professor Laughren is as bad as his current rating suggests.

Not the worst professor. Her grading in this course is very challenging. The final is way too hard to solve as a just starting Econ major. No partials or even anything on the exams. Lectures are a HASSLE to go through, very tough course.
Not friendly, rambles for the entire class on the most useless things. Cannot complete thoughts and always bounces around to fast.

Good professor overall, she has very engaging lectures. Very accessible outside of class too, responds to emails very quickly. Class attendance is mandatory with her. We covered some important materials that were not uploaded to canvas.
Great teacher, had her for 2 classes, sometimes hard to understand and requires a lot of effort but definitely a great teacher of economics

She made me really love Economics as you can tell she really enjoys teaching it too. She's an inspiring and enthusiastic educator. I can see why she'd get bad ratings as the courses she teach are all very challenging. Don't miss any lecture, ask questions, do all homework yourself, read lecture notes before and after classes and you'll do well.

Gulriz struggles with time management, she will go on a 35 minute tangent in a 50 minute lecture about something rather unimportant, but she will gloss over complicated concepts without giving any examples of application. She is also very unclear about what will be on the tests, giving almost no info as to what the exams will look like.

She is one of the best profs I have taken at SFU. To be honest, I was about to quit this course because of her accent but I chose to stay. I love the way she teaches the course, as she always explains the concepts in terms of "english" words, not economics ones. Please go to office hours/ask the prof/TA if you have any questions and you'll do well

She has really good teaching skill. Just attend every lecture and do not miss any tutorial class then you should do well. Her way of explaining concepts is efficientbut it might be hard for those who have weak economic basis to follow. However trying to ask questions during office hoursdo not be shyEcon201 is not that hard as you image.

She is an awesome professor. She teaches the hard classes so it's not her fault its hard. If you go to her office hours and put the work in you will do good. She cares about her students, you won't know that until you start going to office hours. In my opinion she's a really underrated professor. I would definitely take a class with her again.
Worst prof I have had at SFU in 4 years. Doesn't explain concepts clearly, hard to understand and seems unorganized. Take it with anyone else.

The worst prof I ever had! If you can choose someone else to teach you this course, please do, because it can't be any worse than Gulriz Barkin. It's impossible to listen to her in lectures because of her accent, and on top of that she makes even a simple demand and supply difficult.
Specific lecture notes. Participate in every class and do tutorial questions. Go to office hour before exams. It's not that hard as you think.

Dr. Barkin is an incredible professor. Her lectures are engaging and her notes are easy to follow. In Econ 201 be prepared to do a lot of practice questions as the class was entirely exam based when I took it. As long as you work hard outside of class, participate in lectures and show up to tutorial you should do well.

Unclear notes (must read textbook!!) and chooses very easy questions for tutorials that in no way reflect what she would test on. Avoid if you can!! Likes to yell and she should really get a mike instead. Talks about concepts that she doesn't test on and spends a lot of time on them.

She really wants a lot of her students to do well, and encourages everyone to ask questions. Homework is optional but highly recommended to do because it's really similar to what will be on the exams, which were not too bad, and were far from being unfair. If you keep up with the homework you should do alright in the course.
If the class average is very low, she will add marks to everyone to increase class average. She is nice, TAs are also good. Final is hard, but if you done in midterm, you'll be fine.
very good prof

She is a good prof and she is very helpful during her office hour. I just had my final 2 days ago, i have got 80% for my midterms, but i could not understand a single question on her final. She has high expectation on her students. btw, the final made my friend cry.
Horrible. Seems so nice and so knowledgeable, but is so bad at teaching. She doesn't explain what gets tested on, avoid!!!!!!!!!!

She was so helpful. If you want to do well, you just have to attend lecture, and do the problem sets every week. I learned the most from her tutorials. She is really nice and wants her students to do well. She is happy to help you if you are stuck on anything.
Good and helpful teacher, but a tough grader.

Natt is a very helpful TA. He is willing to help even though I am not in his tutorial session. His note are crystal clear and easy to understand and follow. I used to confuse with Econs but now it seems to be that Econs aren't that hard at all.

I made an account just for this prof, he is the worst lecturer ive had. he constantly gets things wrong in class, goes off topic and just confuses students with what he 'teaches' i learned everything from youtube and my TA. he is not capable of teaching! midterm average was 30% and he blamed all the students, but theres only one common denominator

Christophe gets a lot of flack, but the class is doable. He is actually a good lecturer and he explains things really well. The tough part is not having answers to problem sets. If you want to do well, go to multiple tutorial sections and use the TA office hours. Don't fall behind or you are toast. Study group is also essential to make it

Econ 201 is a difficult class, but the lack of practice work makes the class harder. The professor tries to make the exam more difficult than his given examples. His grading is not great. The class average was 25% for the midterm. That's how he grades.

Great Professor. Econ 201 is a tough course. If you get behind, be ready to cry. Christoph is reachable during office hours and is quite straight-forward. The course is semi-curved (variable cutoff grades). Make sure you do all the practice Questions and sleep well the night before the exams -- the exams are difficult to finish.

Pretty good prof, was skeptical at first with the low reviews. Although Econ 201 is not hard, it definitely is tricky and needs more practice than other courses. The tophat quizzes were fair but had confusing formatting. I HIGHLY reccomend focusing mainly on the tutorial questions and shift away from the textbook.

Great professor! Although his lectures are hand written, he gives lots of examples which makes concepts easier to understand. The class is very math heavy but if you understand the concepts and perform above the average you will do well. Biggest advice is go to office hours! He will take the time to explain whatever it is you are confused about.
Chaotic lecturer
The worst professor I've ever have.
HE IS TERRIBLE

Hes a nice person, but his teaching sucks. he has a accent and he's hard to understand, and repeats useless information that we wont be tested on. He makes the concept and material harder than it is. The TAs are also bad and won't help; they are always late and just as bad at explaining and teaching. Top hat is easy and is pretty much attendance

Yeah I failed Econ 201 with him on my first try. The class is incredibly hard but he's actually a decent professor. If you just want to pass, better not take it with him.
He has Top Hat in-class quizzes to force people to go to class. The exams were extremely difficult but looking back on it, you just need to review notes and practice problems.

The professor prefers to use handwriting slides in class which is not very clear but if you go to the lecture every time, then you can understand the concepts. REMEMBER, if you want to success on this course, go to the tutorial every week, ask questions during office hours, also do all the practice he provided.

Do not believe the reviewer below this. One advice? If you are taking this course be ready for hell.... That is all my friends, may you survive. Not only the course materials but the prof itself cannot teach well.

Finals are tomorrow.... but i heard from other students who took this course that he grades really strictly and especially the final. I am scared but might change my review later. The midterm it was graded really strictly, should give more partial marks for work... I say take Joshua Boitnott instead! Way better rating.

A lot of content to cover in a very short amount of time. Don't take this prof, he is not a bad person but he is a bad prof. The TA seemed like they did not know the materials themselves so I guess they hire about anyone. Most of the class is failing and if you are from beedie take BUS207 instead. The average is low always and the marking is tough.

Really harsh grader. Nothing that came on the exams were covered in class or tutorials. I cried a lot during this course. The midterm and finals are graded very harshly. You can barely get your marks up. I attended all lecture and tutorials, studied 10+ hours a week and still did bad. Covers nothing important in lecture.
He doesn't explain everything, only basics. Get ready to suffer.

Christoph is a good prof. He knows the material well and the tests are mostly fair. However, sometimes the material is not conveyed well (i.e.) he would spend too much time on areas with little significance like changing the appearance of an equation. Also, tophat is a good idea but is not it.

It is no doubt that ECON 201 is an hard class, even harder considering it is not curved (but he adjusts the grades). Since I got a 34% on the Midterm after studying a kit, I was so scared I was not gonna pass but I was able to redeem myself during the final. So my tips are: focus on exercises , do tut exercises in advance and go to office hours!
wasn't as bad as I expected from reviews just study and fully understand mock exams and assignments and you'll be fine midterm and final average was about 45% but class was curved
Christoph is the best.

Not as bad as I expected (from reading other reviews). We got the lecture notes + audio explanation which helped, then the live lectures was a review of the notes, so the textbook was not needed. The audio + notes explanation was clear if you remember anything from ECON103 and Calc I. Only downside was having to buy a TopHat subscription ($30ish).

Difficult course. Perhaps he's not used to teaching online but his way of teaching is really hard to follow. A big part of the course is delivered through pre-recorded audio lectures and pre-written notes and his handwriting is horrendous. Recording is also hard to follow since he jumps from topic to topic. Does not go over problems in class.

Seriously made me consider switching faculties altogether. Easy the worst "professor" I've ever had at this school. We all went into midterms and exams completely blind and quelle suprise more than 50% of the class failed each time. Complete fool of a teacher, avoid at all costs if possible.

No notes online, writes his notes at every lecture with his bad hand-writing, hard to pay attention. Furthermore, his notes are very theoretical which usually does not help in doing practice problems. Gives practice exams for mid and final but won't guarantee whether you'll do fine or not. Practice problems are different from the exams.

His lecture is ok,  recommend do not skip class. This course is very logical of analyze economics. 30% of midterm and 70% of final. The format is like 4-5 short answer question and 1-2 long answer question. If you go to the class, the exam is not hard very reasonable.  I like his class, his write notes during the class. Notes very detailed.
Great Prof, Helps a ton

Christoph is a good prof. He is very clear about the course material. His lectures are well - organized. Do all the sample midterms and final, you will find the exams are pretty straightforward. However, the exams are super long. Most students can not finish all of them. So the key for getting a good grade on his course is to PRACTICE!
Rushes through material, especially at the end of his lectures.
the course is tough as well as the test, he had bad handwriting, need to practice the assignment which he gave us

Tests aren't so much tough as they are long. Do the assignments and practice exams. He's clear in lectures but as others said he is theoretical - this is why you need to practice (duh). Lectures are well organized and at a good pace but because of this he's impatient about questions in lecture. Go to his office hours for questions instead.

Hard professor! He will teach you the concepts in class but will not teach you how to solve the problems. The exercises he will give you during tutorials is too easy but prepare to suffer on the midterm and finals.

don't let those who don't come to classes mislead you. Chris is actually a fine teacher. Come to classes; take good notes; DO tutorial homework. Textbook is easy to read. Shouldn't take more than 30min for each chap. Class average is low so it is extremely easy to get an A+. Gotta take good advantage with the poor quality of Econ students at SFU.
Do the sample midterm and assignment and then you will be fine on his exam. Nice prof but has terrible hand-writing :(
The best prof i have ever had, was really helpful. If you need help than go in and ask, if you go in he knows you care and will give you a good mark
Awsome Prof! Actually makes lectures intresting to go to! Watch for hints about exams. Overall very good!
